text: The Washington Freedom, led by captain Steve Smith, won their maiden Major League Cricket title by defeating the San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs at the Grand Prairie Stadium. The Freedom scored 207-5 in 20 overs, with Smith making 88 and Glenn Maxwell contributing 40. In response, the Unicorns were bowled out for 111 in 16 overs, with Carmi le Roux being the top scorer with 20*. The Freedom's bowlers, including Rachin Ravindra, Marco Jansen, and Andrew Tye, played a crucial role in the team's victory. The Freedom finished the season with only one loss, earning them the championship title.

**Team Performance:** The Seattle Orcas had a dismal season in MLC 2, finishing at the bottom of the table with just two points. They lost their final match to the Texas Super Kings by 37 runs.

**Reasons for Poor Performance:** The team's international players, mostly from South Africa, were exhausted after coming straight from the World Cup, which may have contributed to their poor performance.

**Batting Issues:** The Orcas struggled to put consistent runs on the board, especially when opening with the batting. They have lost seven consecutive matches when opening with the paddle since July 15, 2023.

**Positive Debut:** Ayan Desai made a promising debut for the Orcas in the final match, taking two wickets and scoring 30 runs with an economy of 7.50.

**Other Notable Performances:** Ryan Rickleton, the top run-scorer for the Orcas, was dismissed for a golden duck in the final match, while Quentin de Kock scored 26 runs in 19 balls.

**Season Overview:** Despite the Orcas' poor performance, MLC season 2 was a positive step forward for the growth of cricket in the United States.

* Washington Freedom won the MLC 2024 title by defeating San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs in the final.
* Steven Smith top-scored with 88 off 52 balls, including six sixes, and Glenn Maxwell contributed 40 runs to help Washington Freedom reach 207 for 5.
* Marco Jansen and Rachin Ravindra took three wickets each to restrict San Francisco Unicorns to 111 runs.
* Washington Freedom lost only one game in the entire tournament and secured five wins in the group stage before progressing to the final.
* Steven Smith ended the season as the joint second-leading run-scorer with 336 runs at a strike-rate of 148.67, alongside Travis Head.

Overall, the article highlights Washington Freedom's dominant performance in the MLC 2024 tournament, led by the strong batting performances of Steven Smith and Glenn Maxwell, and their ultimate victory in the final.

The article mentions that Accenture was encouraged to sponsor a Major League Cricket team called MI New York. The reason for this is because the franchise is open to using advanced technologies like AI and analytics to improve their performance both on and off the pitch.

The Washington Freedom won their first Major League Cricket title by defeating the San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs in the championship match. The Freedom set a target of 207 runs for 5 wickets in 20 overs, led by Steve Smith's 88 off 52 balls. The Unicorns could only manage 111 runs in 16 overs in response. Marco Jansen and Rachin Ravindra took three wickets each for the Freedom, with Ravindra being economical with 23 runs conceded. This victory marks a strong start to the Freedom's future in Major League Cricket, cementing their position as a formidable team.

**Final Match Details:**
The final match of the MLC 2024 will be played between the Washington Freedom and the San Francisco Unicorns on July 29 at 6:00 AM IST at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Team Previews:**
Both teams have performed well in the tournament, with the Washington Freedom finishing top of the table in the league stage and winning the Qualifier against the San Francisco Unicorns. The Freedom have played all-round cricket, with strong performances from Steve Smith, Travis Head, Saurabh Netravalkar, and Lockie Ferguson. The San Francisco Unicorns, led by Corey Anderson, have also been consistent, with Finn Allen providing good starts and a strong bowling unit.

**Pitch Report:**
The Grand Prairie Stadium pitch is expected to be sporty, with help for spinners throughout the game and pacers coming into play towards the end.

**Probable Playing XIs:**
The article lists the probable playing XIs for both teams, with the Washington Freedom led by Steve Smith and the San Francisco Unicorns led by Corey Anderson.

**Fantasy Tips and Winner Prediction:**
The article provides fantasy tips and predicts the Washington Freedom as the favourites to win the match due to their consistent and all-round performance throughout the tournament.

* The 2024 MLC season is ongoing and has been exciting and highly competitive.
* MI New York, the current champions, are defending their title against strong contenders.
* Notable players like N Pooran and Trent Boult have delivered standout performances.
* The league is heading towards an electrifying playoff phase.
* The eventual crowning of the 2024 champion is anticipated.

**Championship Final:** Washington Freedom won the MLC 2024 trophy by defeating San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs in the final at Grand Prairie Stadium. Freedom set a target of 208, which proved too steep for the Unicorns to chase.

**Key Performances:** Steve Smith scored 88 off 52 balls, while Glenn Maxwell added 40 off 22 balls to help Freedom post a record total of 208. Marco Jansen and Andrew Tye took crucial wickets, while Rachin Ravindra cleaned out the tail with an impressive spell.

**Tournament Awards:**

* Winners: Washington Freedom
* Runners-up: San Francisco Unicorns
* Most Valuable Player of the Tournament: Travis Head (Washington Freedom)
* Leading Run Scorer: Faf du Plessis (Texas Super Kings)
* Leading Wicket Taker: Saurabh Netravalkar (Washington Freedom)
* Domestic Player of the Tournament: Hassan Khan (San Francisco Unicorns)

**Match Result:** San Francisco Unicorns defeated Texas Super Kings by 10 runs in the penultimate match of the 2024 MLC season.

**Scorecard:** San Francisco Unicorns scored 200/6 in 20 overs, with Finn Allen scoring 101 off 53 balls. Texas Super Kings responded with 190/4 in 20 overs, with Devon Conway scoring 62* and Joshua Tromp scoring 56.

**Key Performances:** Finn Allen's explosive century set the tone for the Unicorns, while Noor Ahmad took 3/27 for the Texas Super Kings. Joshua Tromp's 56 off 36 balls kept the Super Kings in the hunt until the final over.

**Next Match:** Texas Super Kings will face Washington Freedom on Sunday, as per the MLC press release. The winner of that match will face San Francisco Unicorns in the title clash.
